intro: Matisia palenquiana, commonly known as the Palequian matisia, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, orange-yellow flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous small, flat seeds. It thrives in humid, lowland forests and is often found in secondary growth areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
